title: Make your sklearn models up to 100 times faster
excerpt: How to considerable reduce training time changing only 1 line of code

title: Counting FLOPS and other CPU counters in Python
excerpt: On the Linux command line it is fairly easy to use the perf command to measure number of floating point operations (or other performance metrics). (See for example this old blog post ) with this approach it is not easy to get a fine grained view of how different stages of processings within a single process. In this short note I describe how the python-papi package can be used to measure the FLOP requirements of any section of a Python program.
